title: Chamonix
summary: Chamonix-Mont-Blanc[lower-alpha 1] (Arpitan: Chamôni), more commonly known as Chamonix,[lower-alpha 2][lower-alpha 3] is a commune in the Haute-Savoie department in the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region of southeastern France. It was the site of the first Winter Olympics in 1924. In 2017, it had a population of 8,611.
